descr.p: When I See You Smile is the second single of American/British hard rock band Bad English, taken from their self-titled debut album Bad English, released in 1989.
In the video the band are performing on a stage, which contains close-up shots of its members. The footage was taken at one of their arena concerts.

In 1992, 16-year-old reggae artist Singing Sweet scored a hit with a cover version in Jamaica and on the dancehall scene in the United States. Other covers were released in 1998 by Uncle Sam on his debut CD, and in 2006 by Clay Aiken on his CD A Thousand Different Ways.
In August 2007 the Dutch producers duo P&A remixed "When I See You Smile" as a dance version.
In 2008, Filipina singer Nina Girado recorded her own version of the song for her album Nina Sings The Hits of Diane Warren.
